page.title: 04HOUSING STANDARDS AND NEEDS
page.content: The area contains some stark contrast that compare the unchanging rural community with the needs of a modern, prosperous and mobile society. The old village of Harrietsham is the largest grouping of houses. Most of the houses are well over fifty years old. In compleat contrast the council housing estates immediately south of the parish church represent sound modern housing of modest form, while at Lakelands adjoining the railway expensive modern housing can be seen on an estate of private houses. The village has as yet suffered little change, remaining basically a rural community on an important road link. The proposed M20 motorway may well change that.
